list_definition.definition: to frighten eg by threatening violence

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: I was intimidated by the doorman’s aggressive attitude.

list_ex_of_english: Together with war veterans and youth militias they intimidate his opponents and suppress dissent, whereas military men play an increasingly important role in the economy.
He hesitates to say who he "really" is because he is too easily intimidated on the phone, and announces himself instead as his old assistant.
They had begun by being intimidated by the new machine, but quickly had adapted to it.
Possessing a seemingly independent psychological agency, the womb harboured concentrated powers of intimidating female sexuality.
Both then and now rural electorates have been intimidated.
Above all, he wanted to use the vigilantes to intimidate his opponents.
This is an odd choice in that such volumes are hardly likely to appeal to those who are intimidated by footnotes.
Her mastery, enviable and evidently intimidating, is comfortingly confounded with complicity.
